name: heretical
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
opposite to or against the official or popular opinion, or showing no respect for the official opinion: He did not reveal his heretical views on the drug war until after he was reelected. Her belief that a split would be good for the party was regarded as heretical. See
heretic
(of a belief) against the principles of a particular religion: The Gnostic gospels were considered heretical. He says that he and his wife are free of sin - a heretical claim for Christians.
More examplesFewer examplesSuch a heretical view would have been unthinkable a couple of years ago. Let me offer a heretical thought: does it really matter if your baby was swapped at birth?He doesn't have a drivers license and doesn't want one, a heretical notion to most American teenagers.He was arrested and tried for his heretical views.
